abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Armenia Second irrigation Dam Safety Project, which aims
            to protect the population and the socioeconomic
            infrastructure downstream of the dams facing the highest
            risk of failure; and contribute to enhancing the
            sustainability of economic activities that are dependent on
            a reliable supply of water. This report discusses potential
            negative impacts and proposes measures to mitigate them. To
            offset impacts connected with new spillway construction and
            reconstruction of existing spillways, slope protection, and
            rehabilitation of an irrigation outlet,  employ the
            following measures: construct tunnel waterways in lieu of
            open trenches and widen existing spillways. Avoid improper
            disposal of excavated materials and construction wastes that
            might damage the vegetal cover and pollute water by
            obtaining permits, providing zones of preliminary
            accumulation of wastes, disposing of wastes according to
            established procedures and in designated areas, and
            restoring excavated materials for slope protection. To
            prevent topsoil loss due to temporary access roads and work
            areas, delineate access roads/work areas carefully and
            prevent their expansion, and restore vegetal cover. Use
            closed/covered trucks to transport construction materials,
            and clean area from dust by sprinkling water, removing
            excess materials, and clearing sites. Arrange preservation
            measures -protection areas, bypasses-and cease works when
            encountering historical/cultural monuments. Restore
            landscape after works are completed.
